# {{COURSE_NAME}} Capstone Rubric

> Detailed grading criteria for capstone evaluation

## Grading Summary

| Category | Weight | Max Points |
|----------|--------|------------|
| Functionality | 40% | 40 |
| Code Quality | 25% | 25 |
| Best Practices | 20% | 20 |
| Documentation | 15% | 15 |
| **Total** | **100%** | **100** |

## Category 2: Code Quality (25 points)

### Readability (10 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 10 | Exceptionally clear, well-formatted, consistent style throughout |
| 8-9 | Clear and readable, minor formatting issues |
| 6-7 | Generally readable, some inconsistencies |
| 4-5 | Difficult to read in places, inconsistent |
| 0-3 | Hard to follow, poor formatting |

**What to look for:**
- [ ] Consistent indentation
- [ ] Meaningful variable/function names
- [ ] Appropriate whitespace
- [ ] Logical code organization

---

### Maintainability (8 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 8 | Highly modular, DRY, easy to modify |
| 6-7 | Well-organized, minimal duplication |
| 4-5 | Some organization, moderate duplication |
| 2-3 | Poor organization, significant duplication |
| 0-1 | Monolithic, hard to maintain |

**What to look for:**
- [ ] Functions/methods have single responsibility
- [ ] No duplicated code blocks
- [ ] Appropriate abstraction level
- [ ] Clear module/file structure

---

### Comments & Documentation (7 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 7 | Excellent inline comments, all complex logic explained |
| 5-6 | Good comments on most complex sections |
| 3-4 | Some comments, but gaps in complex areas |
| 1-2 | Minimal comments |
| 0 | No comments |

**What to look for:**
- [ ] Functions have docstrings/JSDoc
- [ ] Complex logic is explained
- [ ] Comments are accurate and helpful
- [ ] No obvious/redundant comments

---

## Category 3: Best Practices (20 points)

### Course Patterns Applied (10 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 10 | All relevant patterns from course applied correctly |
| 8-9 | Most patterns applied, minor deviations |
| 6-7 | Some patterns applied, some missed opportunities |
| 4-5 | Few patterns applied |
| 0-3 | Course patterns not evident |

**Patterns to look for:**
- [ ] {{PATTERN_1}}
- [ ] {{PATTERN_2}}
- [ ] {{PATTERN_3}}
- [ ] {{PATTERN_4}}

---

### Error Handling (5 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 5 | Comprehensive error handling, graceful failures |
| 4 | Good error handling, most cases covered |
| 3 | Basic error handling |
| 1-2 | Minimal error handling |
| 0 | No error handling |

---

### Testing (5 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 5 | Comprehensive tests, high coverage, all pass |
| 4 | Good test coverage, all tests pass |
| 3 | Basic tests, all pass |
| 1-2 | Minimal tests or some failing |
| 0 | No tests or all failing |

---

## Category 4: Documentation (15 points)

### README (8 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 8 | Complete README with all required sections, professional |
| 6-7 | Good README, minor gaps |
| 4-5 | Basic README, missing some sections |
| 2-3 | Minimal README |
| 0-1 | No README or unusable |

**Required sections:**
- [ ] Project overview
- [ ] Installation instructions
- [ ] Usage guide
- [ ] Configuration options
- [ ] Known limitations

---

### API/Technical Documentation (7 points)

| Score | Criteria |
|-------|----------|
| 7 | Complete API docs, clear examples |
| 5-6 | Good documentation, minor gaps |
| 3-4 | Basic documentation |
| 1-2 | Minimal documentation |
| 0 | No documentation |

---

## Deductions

| Issue | Deduction |
|-------|-----------|

---

## Grading Scale

| Grade | Score | Description |
|-------|-------|-------------|
| A+ | 97-100+ | Exceptional work |
| A | 93-96 | Excellent work |
| A- | 90-92 | Very good work |
| B+ | 87-89 | Good work |
| B | 83-86 | Above average |
| B- | 80-82 | Satisfactory |
| C+ | 77-79 | Acceptable |
| C | 70-76 | Minimum passing |
| F | <70 | Does not meet requirements |
